edu.rit.pj2

Class JobWorkQueue<W extends Tuple>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.JobWorkQueue<W>
  • Type Parameters:
    W - Data type of the work items. The work item class must be a subclass of class Tuple.

    public class JobWorkQueue<W extends Tuple>
extends java.lang.Object
    Class JobWorkQueue provides a distributed queue of work items to be processed by a cluster parallel program (job). There can be only one distributed work queue in a job. The queue is implemented via tuple space.

    Note: For a work queue in a single-task parallel program, see class WorkQueue.

    Programming pattern. To execute a parallel loop over a series of work items in a cluster parallel Job, follow this pattern in the job's main() method: 

     public class MyJob extends Job
     {
     public void main (String[] args)
         {
         JobWorkQueue<W> queue = getJobWorkQueue (W.class, workers());
         queue.add (initial_work_item);
         rule() .task (workers(), worker_task_class);
         }
     }
    W is the data type of the work items; this class must be a subclass of class Tuple. queue is used to access the job's work queue in the job main program. Get a reference to the job's work queue by calling the job's getJobWorkQueue() method; the arguments are the class of the work items and the number of worker tasks in the job; the latter is typically specified by querying the job's workers property. Call the queue's add() method one or more times to add initial work items to the queue. Call the job's rule() method to set up the job's worker tasks; the number of worker tasks must be the same as was specified in the getJobWorkQueue() method call.

    Follow this pattern in the worker task's main() method: 

     public class MyTask extends Task
     {
     public void main (String[] args)
         {
         JobWorkQueue<W> queue = getJobWorkQueue (W.class);
         W workitem = null;
         while ((workitem = queue.remove()) != null)
             {
             // Code to process workitem
             queue.add (another_work_item); // Optional
             }
         }
     }
    W is the data type of the work items. queue is used to access the job's work queue in the task main program. Get a reference to the job's work queue by calling the task's getJobWorkQueue() method; the argument is the class of the work items. Call the queue's remove() method to get a work item; process the work item; if needed, call the queue's add() method one or more times to add more work items to the queue; and repeat until the remove() method returns null. The task must be single threaded.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(W workitem)
      Add the given work item to this job work queue.
      W remove()
      Remove and return the next work item from this job work queue.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(W workitem)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Add the given work item to this job work queue.
        Parameters:
        workitem - Work item; must be non-null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if workitem is null.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • remove

        public W remove()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Remove and return the next work item from this job work queue. This method will block until either a work item is available or there are no more work items.
        Returns:
        Work item, or null if there are no more work items.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.
